resources.string:
Dalal street is a virtual stock exchange game, where the companies sell their stocks to the public at a price 
which depends on the company market value and performance. 
The public then buy or sell the stocks among them for price based on the market events are stock transactions. 
At the end of the game, the player who makes the most money through the stock exchange wins. 
The following is a guide explaining the structure of the game and what each feature of the game means.


Home 
The basic details of all the companies like the company's stock price and the status 
( whether the company is gaining or losing value in the stock market ) 
are shown in the home tab.


Stock exchange 
This is where you play the actual game. 
You can buy stock or sell stock from other players in the stock exchange. 
When buying, you can ask for a particular number of stocks at a particular price. 
If someone is willing to sell their stocks at your asked price (or lower), 
a transaction is made and you get the stocks. An equivalent amount will be deducted from your 
monetary wealth. 
 Here, there is another feature, called the stoploss order. 
If you provide a stoploss order, the transaction is made even if someone sells the stock for a price 
higher than your asked price, provided that the margin of difference does 
not exceed a particular amount. 

When selling your stocks, you can sell the stocks you already own for a price 
called the bid price. 
Similarly, a match is made if someone is willing to buy those stocks at a price 
greater then, or equal to the bid price. 
The stoploss order has a similar kind of function in bidding too.


Bank Mortgage 
Bank Mortgage can be used to mortgage stocks with the bank at 75%(may vary during the course of time) 
of the present price of the mortgaged stocks and later the mortgaged stocks 
can be bought back from the bank at the stocks current price.


Transactions 
This tab shows all the successful and ongoing transactions that you made. 
If a transaction is not successful, it means that you bid too high, or you ask too low.


Portfolio 
This Tab shows your profile information, including the number of stocks you have 
from every company, the wealth you have as money, and the total wealth you own 
 through stocks.


News 
This tab shows all the market events belonging to different companies. This will 
help you in determining each company's performance, and inturn, give you an idea 
of what stocks to buy\sell. 
 Please note that these events are purely fictional and are nowhere related to the 
real marker conditions


Performance 
This tab contains graphs drawn using the past performance of a given company.


Market depth 
Market depth tells us the different price range for which people have 
asked and bid stocks belonging to a particular company. 
It contains two histograms for a given company, one for bids and one for asks.


Do not hesitate to contact us if you face any problems. 
Have a great Pragyan!
